hypothesis_content.title: Intraday VIX-Crypto Divergence Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: A sharp, >8% spike in the Spot VIX (VIX9D or VIX) occurring within a 90-minute window, while major crypto (BTC/ETH) shows price resilience (range < 0.5 ATR) and declining relative volume (<0.8x its 24hr avg), creates a short-term bullish edge for crypto over the next 6-12 hours as 'fear spillover' subsides.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Rapid VIX spikes often reflect short-term equity market panic (e.g., index rebalancing, single-stock volatility). If crypto, a correlated but distinct asset, fails to participate in the panic (low range, low volume), it suggests the fear is localized. As the VIX spike mean-reverts, capital may rotate back into resilient assets like crypto, creating a tactical bounce.
entry_conditions: Spot VIX (or VIX9D) rises >8% within any 90-minute period (e.g., 10:00-11:30 ET)
BTC 90-min price range during same window is < 0.5 * its 24hr ATR
BTC volume during window is < 0.8x its 24-hour average volume
Regime is NEUTRAL or BULL (not STRESS)
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 60% of such setups see BTC eventually follow the VIX-spike-induced risk-off move with a lag >3 hours, invalidating the decoupling thesis.
